attributes.action: Extend the timetable for district councils to submit their Local plans
attributes.background: Plans based their housing numbers on several factors (migration, economic growth, etc). The data supporting these factors may no longer be valid given the significant risks that have emerged post BREXIT. Councils should be required to review the risks and reconfirm their housing requirements.

attributes.action: Open premises to homeless people when the temperature falls.
attributes.background: change the law, to require anyone who is responsible for a community centre or a sports hall to open their premises to homeless people when the temperature falls below a certain level.
attributes.additional_details: Just read a news story about a guy freezing to death on the coldest night of the year. It reached -9'c here. Its a simply request, which would help in cold weather, not a quick fix, but a start!

attributes.action: For Corby to have their own hospital.
attributes.background: We have the urgent care centre in Corby, also known as 8-8. Who claim to have the resources of a hospital like KGH, but they do not. They lack observing sick patients. Mainly young children, to the point where they don't carry out the right tests to determine if that patient is really sick.
attributes.additional_details: The only evidence I have is my own son, who may I quote is only 1 in a few days. I recently took him to the urgent care centre on the 5/12/16, because his lack of breathing and chesty cough. I was sat there for four hours to only be told he's fine and his chest is clear. He had no observations done. The next day my son was rushed to hospital and I was told he was lacking oxygen really bad (65 out of 100 to be persist) he then had to have 5ml of steroids (oral) 8-8 failed my little boy.

attributes.action: Require all transport operators to offer child fares for anyone under 18
attributes.background: Change the law to require all transport operators to offer under 18's a child fair to help financially support 16!17 year olds of the UK. We are being classed as adults when it suits financially only.
attributes.additional_details: 16/17 year olds are paid a child wage so why should we pay an adult fare for a bus or a train? Until 18, we are not treated as an adult by the law. Until we are 18, parents and doctors can legally consent medical treatment which over rules our say. It seems to be all that is cared about is getting more money. As a 16 year old preparing for the cost of insuring a car and saving for university, it is essentially unaffordable, and this is the reality for most of us.

attributes.action: Allocate the child maintenance service with pre paid cards
attributes.background: This should be a made legal that the receiving parent receives a pre paid card that can only be spent on items for the children! Not alcohol, nights out, cigarettes ect.. I think it's time someone done something to help the paying parent for a change as they are the one out working and providing..
attributes.additional_details: I think that many paying parents would agree with what I am trying to get across.. children need the benefit of the money, not the receiving parent! A prepaid card would be best. One that can be used in certain shops for certain items. Food, soft drinks, shoes, school clothes, toys ect.. not for use for their own pleasure! Thank you

attributes.action: Make 12 November 2018 a Bank Holiday to commemorate 100 yrs since the Great War.
attributes.background: Over 1.1 million Service men and women lost their lives in the Great War. We invite you to create a dedication to each and every one of them and celebrate what they achieved. This day will be devoted to the remembrance of the fallen and to support charities across the UK dedicated to this cause.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to cause injury to a ridden horse on a public road.
attributes.background: Due to an ever increasing number of serious accidents reported on UK roads involving horses, we feel that further care needs to be taken by other road users. The fact that there is no penalty for causing injury to horses by driving dangerously does not encourage drivers to use proper care.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory at all schools to have a time dedicated for napping.
attributes.background: A recent NASA study revealed that a 20 minute nap boosted cognition by almost 40%. Therefore in order for a students to fully focus throughout their school day the government should urge schools to set apart a time of day for sleep. Schools could provide dark rooms or pods for sleep only.

attributes.action: All businesses to have disabled access including a ramp and moving space inside.
attributes.background: A lot of small businesses don't have disabled access, preventing people (like my mother who was diagnosed with rheumatoid and osteoarthritis a few years back) entering shops. Some that do have a ramp to allow the disabled into the store don't have enough space to allow navigation around the store.
attributes.additional_details: Please help make it illegal for shops to not have disabled access (a ramp and enough space inside) as this prevents people, like my mother, entering shops whatsoever.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics into the Key Stage 3 & 4 curriculum
attributes.background: We believe that politics should be an evenly taught subject with the objective to inform learners of what policies the current government have in place and the effect these can have on the country. Also to avoid being mislead by any inaccurate advertising by any campaign.
attributes.additional_details: "£350 million a week goes to the EU, let's put that into the NHS" - Misleading to those without an understanding of what the £350 million actually goes on.

attributes.action: Ban Wearing Burka's While Driving
attributes.background: I and many others will agree that woman wearing a burka should not be allowed to drive a vehicle this is highly dangerous as you do not have full vision of the road and things surrounding you.
attributes.additional_details: I understand this item of clothing worn is a sign of religion. This does not take away the fact of how dangerous wearing this is whilst driving. This has been recently banned in France and I think the UK should take action against this to prevent very serious accidents or even death happening.

attributes.action: Reduce the size of Motorcycle number plates
attributes.background: With HD cameras ANPR and better surveillance cameras the late 7 x 9 plate is not required and a more streamlined 6 x 4 plate would be adequate.  Motorcyclists can find the large plates cause drag and that also has a cost in respect of fuel usage. A smaller plate is more carbon efficient therefore.

attributes.action: Keep the army bound by the European Convention on Human Rights during conflict.
attributes.background: In her conference speech, Theresa May declared that the army would have an opt-out of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) during conflict. This means, in effect, that the army would have a free hand to violate basic human rights such as freedom from torture and the right to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details: The ECHR is an international treaty, drafted in 1950 and championed by British governments ever since. It sets out a series of fundamental rights that governments are bound to respect. This Convention was signed and ratified by the British government in the aftermath of the WWII to ensure that the human rights violations during this conflict would not happen again. For more information on the rights that the ECHR protects, visit: www.echr.coe.int/Documents/Convention_ENG.pdf

attributes.action: Ban all schools from using mini buses.
attributes.background:
Schools drive pupils/students around in mini buses on basic car licences.
Ban all schools from doing this unless they employ a qualified PCV licence holder with up to date CPC card.
attributes.additional_details:
If schools had to use coach companies it would create jobs and boost business.
All drivers are qualified and CRB checked so children would be safe still.

attributes.action: Stop Southeastern Railway from increasing their 2017 ticket fares
attributes.background:
Southeaster railway continues to increase annual season ticket fares each year but never improve upon the service they offer. It was voted one of the worst ways to commute to London in 2016. 
Train fares have been reported to increase twice as fast as salaries in the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
We all pay thousands of pounds a year to travel into London or elsewhere via Southeastern railway and each year it gets more expensive and the service gets worse and worse with signalling problems, delayed trains, cancelled trains etc. 
It needs to stop so that everyone pays a FAIR amount for the poor service we are getting. I'm sure most would agree that we would be happy to pay the amount we are paying if the trains ran on time and without delays and if we all got a seat on our long commutes.

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: To make food banks a legal obligation for all supermarkets in the UK.
attributes.background: Food banks play a big part in helping the homeless. Fortunately, some supermarkets have food banks, however there are still many large supermarkets who don't. We want to make a change, and make it policy that all supermarkets provide food banks to give back to the community.
attributes.additional_details: It costs nothing for supermarkets to provide this service, however it will make a huge difference to those in the community who need it.

attributes.action: Exteremly poor service, revoke Govia Ltd's franchise of Great Northern Railways
attributes.background: GNR are continuously running a bad service. They have ongoing late running trains and often cancel services due to lack of staff and broken trains. They have not invested in new rolling stock and the trains are constantly dirty, seats are broken and trains break down.

attributes.action: Lowering the state pension age for women born in the 50s back to 60 years old.
attributes.background: My mother was born on the 10th december 1953, if she was born 4 days earlier she would have retired 2 and half years ago. I'm sure a lot of the country is in the same situation. There wasn't enough time for people born in the 50s to save. This needs to change back to the state pension age of 60.

attributes.action: Make accusing someone of been a racist without hard evidence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: In light of the recent EU referendum decision and increase in reports of hate crimes, a lot of innocent, decent and hardworking people like myself have been victims of accusations suggesting (with no proof or evidence to support their claims) that people who voted to leave the EU are somehow racist.
attributes.additional_details:
Branding someone as racist without any categorical evidence what so ever also seems to be a tactic that is becoming more of a problem in political and also everyday situations. 

Certain demographics of people are using this tactic to persecute other demographics of people in order to silence their personal views or beliefs to further their own personal or political agendas.

Been racist is a disgusting crime and been wrongly accused with no evidence can be permanently damaging to peoples lives.

attributes.action: Treat male and female victims of domestic and sexual violence equally.
attributes.background: The UK government sees domestic and sexual abuse as a gender issue. £50 million + is spent funding services for female victims. Nothing is spent on male victims.1/3 of all victims are male. 1 in 6 men experience abuse. The government needs a minister for men and boys, there is a minister for women.
attributes.additional_details: Research suggests 1 in 6 men experience some form of abuse. 30 men each year are killed. No government funding is provided to any service for male victims of domestic abuse, some money is given to the men's advice line. There are approx 10 000 refuge beds specifically for women, there are around 20 for men. 2 out of every 5 victims are male 40% men need 40% of the budget allocated to services to fund refuge beds, outreach support etc. This is not a gender issue this is about victims not gender.

attributes.action: Hold an all-party public inquiry into bullying and harassment in Parliament
attributes.background:
Recent difficulties in relations between MP's in the Labour Party have highlighted an endemic culture of bullying within HoC.

Bullying & harassment aren't accepted in any other workplace or institution in the UK. This toxic culture is harming individuals and politics more widely.
attributes.additional_details:
MP reduced to tears watching personal attacks at Labour leader designed to "Break him as a man": http://tinyurl.com/zl268n5

Some of these MPs have since stated they felt extreme pressure to vote "no confidence" in the leader

Conservative MPs have spoken out against bullying behaviour and how ineffective current anti-bullying measures are: http://tinyurl.com/z8se6nz

We need

* Full inquiry into bullying into HoC
* Measures to bring protection for MPs and HoC staff in line with other workplaces

attributes.action: Increase the maximum sentence for those found guilty of cruelty to a child
attributes.background: Innocence.The innocence of a baby or child should be cherished. But not all think that way. Some people see that innocence as their's to take. They neglect, ill-treat and assault. We've all read the stories, cried and screamed in disbelief at the sentences. It is time to do something about it.
attributes.additional_details: Cruelty to a child under the Children and Young Persons Act 1933 s.1 carries a maximum sentence of 10 years imprisonment. It includes a range of offences; neglect, abandonment, assault and cruelty, whether carried out once or numerous times. Children who this Act is meant to protect will never get their stolen innocence back and they get no justice with a maximum sentence of 10 years for those who stole it. The maximum sentence for those found guilty of child cruelty needs to be increased.

attributes.action: Make First Aid Training compulsory in Schools, Colleges and new drivers
attributes.background: We should follow other European countries and make first aid training compulsory at various levels in schools and colleges and First training be compulsory for new drivers
attributes.additional_details: Sweden, Norway , Germany all deliver first aid at school age and for new drivers

attributes.action: British Government to reconsider its decision to renew the Lease on Chagos
attributes.background: The British Government decided to stop resettlement of the Chagossians. The Government should stop the renewal of the Lease in December 2016. If proceeds the natives would be too old or be dead in 2036, when  the lease expires.  Exiled for over 40 years. Join me in condemning this decision.
attributes.additional_details: The British Government has recently made £40M available in a pot to assist the Chagossians over the next 10 years. The sum is not sufficient to redress the wrong-doings by the Government and instead a more legitimate programme for resettlement of the Chagossians should be considered, wherever the Chagossians are today, irrespective of their current circumstances.  All the Chagossians HAVE BEEN UPROOTED and therefore should EACH be treated equally in benefiting from any form of redress.

attributes.action: Make putting an offer on a house purchase in England legally binding.
attributes.background: Far too many people are being let down and are also suffering unnecessary costs from the fact that people can put an offer on a house they want to buy and then withdraw at any point before exchange without penalty.
attributes.additional_details: Buying and selling houses is such a life changing and costly process it should not be subject to people changing their minds in a whim.  Many families can suffer heartache when a house chain collapses due to a person simply changing their mind.  I propose that before people enter a bid on a house they should get a survey and any searches competed and be in a position to pay a deposit.   This would add an a strong element of security to the house buying and selling process.

attributes.action: Allow current/new students to have free text books for university courses
attributes.background: It is only fair that current/new students get the fulfilment of their university course they pay for (£9,000 a year), by providing free set text books for each course they are on.
attributes.additional_details: With the decision made by the Government for tuition fees to rise further to £9,250 in the academic year of 2017, it is plausible for Parliament to enforce this.

attributes.action: legislate to pay travel time from home as paid work to first job and last
attributes.background: Time spent travelling to and from first and last jobs by workers who do not have a fixed office should be regarded as work and should go on time sheet as paid work as workers are being stopped 10 hours per week
attributes.additional_details: the European Court of Justice judgement ruled those without a fixed or habitual office should consider the time they spend travelling between their homes and the premises of their first and last jobs as part of their hours for the day

attributes.action: Mandatory vision and reaction check-up for all 75+ with a UK Driving license.
attributes.background: I have had personal experience of elderly drivers on wrong side of the road, being oblivious to cyclists, pulling out on roundabouts not noticing vehicles, stopping in main roads and causing serious collisions due to poor sight and reactions.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 over 75 year olds in the UK are suffering with vision loss; and from research I have found there are approximately 4 Million drivers over the age of 70 on UK roads.

The current system in place allows the individual to self-assess and to alert the DVLA if they are not fit to drive. In many cases if the individual needs the car for transport they will be reluctant to inform of any changes in health, vision etc. Completing a fast assessment will eliminate any possibility of this.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents not to vaccinate a child
attributes.background:
Not vaccinating your children makes two things more likely
- Your child will get sick
- Your child will spread that illness to other unprotected children, some of whom may be too young to have received the necessary vaccination.
Therefore, not getting your child vaccinated is grossly negligent.
attributes.additional_details: Herd immunity is the primary reason for mass immunisation - in layman's terms, it means that the more people are immunised against a given disease, the less that disease will be able to spread, and more people (especially children too young to receive that specific vaccination) will be safe from it. We call on the government to criminalise non-vaccinating parents who refuse an initial order to vaccinate.

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis users to grow upto 5 plants without fear of prosecution
attributes.background: We are here to ask for the law to allow us users the ability to grow up to FIVE plants for personal use across the UK (Durham have already done this, as well as almost ALL of the USA with states by-passing the DEA to allow users access Washington State recently) from seed without taking cuttings!

attributes.action: Change the law all assets to be sold/split equally when a relationship ends.
attributes.background: Current law allows the parent remaining with the kids to remain in the family home till the youngest turns 18. Leaving the other parent potentially homeless. The law needs to change so that the when separation/divorce happens all assets should be sold/divided equally allowing both to move on
attributes.additional_details: I am currently living with family as I can not afford nor get help with housing. I share my kids so when I have them I rely on family to put me and my kids up. This is extremely unfair on all. I am not the first nor will I be the last to find myself in this situation. Most people will know of someone having the same issue as myself. Mediation/solicitors/court costs if the law was changed so that when a couple separate/divorce all assets should be sold/divided equally it would save time and money

attributes.action: Change the dogs (fouling on land) act to include non public land
attributes.background: I live in a council property where the garden is shared. Another tennant leaves his dogs to defeacate in the garden without clearing it up. The council haven't acted in 4 months and police say can't enforce as land is not covered under the dogs (fouling on land) as its private or council property.
attributes.additional_details: I have video and photographic evidence of the fouling which has been left to rot for weeks/months where the garden is unfit for human use as confirmed by the local dog warden. The council had no housing officer covering the area so no one dealt with the complaint. Police could not act however if they could then this situation would not have got out of hand. And we wouldn't have to wait for the council.

attributes.action: The EU flag be flown from parliament on alternate days with the Union Flag.
attributes.background: This petition grows out of national frustration with the referendum, and at how various governments, over the decades, have failed to promote the benefits of the EU to the public at large.
attributes.additional_details:
Flags are matters of high symbolic importance. In most EU member states, the EU flag is routinely flown alongside the national flag. This practice should have been instituted in the UK long ago. 
The most prominent flagstaff in the land is that on Parliament itself. For practical reasons it may not be possible to hoist two, thus the proposal is for flying the UK and EU flags on alternate days.

attributes.action: A 5 year ban from public office for politicians who knowingly lie to the public.
attributes.background: The Brexit  debate has frustrated people on both sides. There have been many opinions put forward as facts but there have also been outright lies and some people believed them and are now annoyed. If a citizen said some of these things they would be sued but it seems OK if a politician says them.
attributes.additional_details: £350 million pounds a week will be diverted from the EU to the NHS. 75 million Turks are on their way to Britain.

attributes.action: Elmbridge Borough to become 33rd London borough following EU referendum
attributes.background: As London voted to remain in the EU, it is more evident than ever the similarities that the Borough of Elmbridge in North Surrey shares with neighbouring Greater London. As talks of further devolution of London develop, Elmbridge citizens must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
In the EU referendum, 60% voted to remain with a turnout of 78%, similar to that of London.
Elmbridge has a vibrant economy with over 5000 firms situated in the borough.
Over 45% of Elmbridge's population are educated to degree level.
Unemployment peaked at 7% in 1993 but since then has been on the decline and reached a low of 0.9% in 2000.

attributes.action: Make it offence to film members of the emergency service for negative propaganda
attributes.background: There has been a recent increase in the number of cases via media channels (Facebook, YouTube) by members of the public recording Emergency Services, NHS and HM forces personnel, whilst causing harassment to provoke a reaction so the footage can be uploaded and used a negative propaganda.
attributes.additional_details: Propaganda is defined by Nelson (1996) as "a systematic form of purposeful persuasion that attempts to influence the emotions, attitudes, opinions, and actions of specified target audiences for ideological, political or commercial purposes through the controlled transmission of one-sided messages (which may or may not be factual) via mass and direct media channels.

attributes.action: Pass law to impound vehicles/caravans of travellers who damage public land.
attributes.background: Recently a travellers community has twice descended on our village, and twice been rapidly evicted by the local Council. The travellers, who act with a wholesome contempt for the law, have twice caused an indescribable and costly mess. This is a UK-wide problem. It's time to stop to this behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: If a group of travellers dumps vast quantities of bulk rubbish and human waste while they occupy public land, it costs tax payers' money to clean up. In these circumstances, the group's behaviour forfeits their right to live in this way. If they knew they could lose their vehicles/caravans, maybe they would behave differently. It's time to put a stop to this anti-social behaviour. Sign the petition and let's get our MPs to raise this issue in a Parliamentary debate!”

attributes.action: Regulate mobile phone bundled contracts to stop hidden charges & data misselling
attributes.background: Consumer request to regulate over-charging in 24 month bundled contracts, ensuring clearer, transparent pricing for both the phone and the tariff in the contract, ensuring customers can get access to their data consumption and aren’t overcharged for data they don’t need, or overpay for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
consumers know they aren't getting the best deal http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-3517540/The-mobile-phone-rip-Confusing-tariffs-unclear-pricing-shoddy-sales-staff-mean-overpaying-130-phone-contracts.html 
over £5bn per year being wasted by being on the wrong contracts https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2011/apr/11/mobile-phone-users-wasting-5bn customers need have greater access and more control over their service contracts with the networks http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3973532/Millions-mobile-phone-users-able-ditch-supplier-mid-contract-t-signal-plan-MPs-beat-coverage-blackspots.html

attributes.action: Extend sentencing powers to allow the use of lifetime bans from driving.
attributes.background: Many motorists obey the law till they get behind a steering wheel. They don't ever think of going to jail but would relate more to the possibility of being banned from driving for life. Such bans would be at the judge's discretion and only used for repeated bad driving or the most heinous incidents.
attributes.additional_details:
The kinds of cases I am thinking about include repeated use of mobile phones and repeated cases of drink- or drug-driving resulting in injury/death, or killing/injuring someone while driving at more than 20 per cent over a speed limit. 

While a long jail sentence is not always good for society, a short sentence and lifetime ban would emphasise the seriousness of an offence and give victims/relatives a stronger impression that justice had been done. Jail would be an option for breaches of a ban.

attributes.action: Abellio Greater Anglia should compensate for delays longer than 15 minutes
attributes.background:
The lines operated by Abellio Greater Anglia are frequently subject to delays, causing severe disruption. 

The delay repay scheme should be amended to refund for delays greater than 15 minutes, instead of the current 30 minute threshold.
attributes.additional_details: The train operator c2c offer pro-rata compensation on delays over 2 minutes.

attributes.action: change the law of dogs on public footpaths and open land to no dogs allowed.
attributes.background: due to increasing livestock attacks due to dogs and a outdated law which can never be enforced if the police have no evidence then no action can be taken against the owners of the dog if they can be found...which in turn causes tens of thousands of damage to livestock and wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: its a well known fact the British news media does not report the real accounts of how many dog attacks there is on livestock / wildlife, but on other media sites it's widespread ..farming forums farming press you tube  etc ...but not everyone reads this media ..this law needs rewritten to which if there is no  written permission given for dogs allowed on a public path /open land then no dogs allowed ..

attributes.action: Change rules for working Carers to hours worked, instead of £110 per week.
attributes.background: At the moment the rules for receiving Carer's Allowance states that you cannot earn more than £110 per week. If the government changed the rules to specify someone in receipt of CA can only work a certain number of hours instead it would be a lot more fair.
attributes.additional_details:
£110 divided by £7.20 (minimum wage) = 15 hours (approx)
£110 divided by £9.50 = 11.5 hours (approx)
Therefore someone on a lower wage is clearly disadvantaged, because they have to work longer hours to earn the weekly allowance.  This then means that the disabled person is disadvantaged by not having their carer present.

If the rules state you can work 15 hours it would be much fairer to all carers.

https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage-rates
https://www.gov.uk/carers-allowance/eligibility

attributes.action: Give Special Constables who complete over 200 hours a year a tax incentive
attributes.background: Special Constables provide vital support to front line policing, giving up their free time, often days away from family, and even using leave from work to perform duties. Though no Special Constables do this for financial reward, all duties are performed voluntarily, often risking their own safety.
attributes.additional_details: Special Constables are expected to perform a minimum of 16 hours a month, yet most Special Constables go above and beyond, some completing upwards of 60 hours a month. One East Midlands force had Special Constables perform over 60,000 hours of duty in 2015, 59% of which were spent on frontline policing duties, responding to 999 calls and life or death situations. The rest carried out where either on local policing initiatives, community safety and training.

attributes.action: No assessments for DLA recipients when changing to PIP
attributes.background:
For people with long term disabilities that will not get better

If you have lost limbs, or an invisible disabilities such as Dyspraxia, Autism, or any disability that will never get better. ( There are loads of examples I could mention) You should not have to be reassessed for PIP.

attributes.action: Host a Referendum for an English National Anthem.
attributes.background: Our proposal of a public referendum would be an effective way of allowing the people of England to choose for themselves how they wish to express their identity in our family of nations. Just as Wales are permitted with Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau, and Scotland with Flower of Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: https://web.archive.org/web/20100615152120/http://www.weareengland.org/news.asp?itemid=327&itemTitle=England+announce+victory+anthem+for+Delhi+chosen+by+the+public%21&section=115&sectionTitle=News

attributes.action: Bring the unaccompanied minors and others in the refugee camp in Calais to UK
attributes.background: To ask the Home Office to issue humanitarian visas to all those in the Calais camp (and the smaller number in Dunkerque) and arrange safe transport to Britain. As a priority, the unaccompanied minors should be brought to Britain as per the Dubs amendment.
attributes.additional_details: Two weeks ago, I went on a six day visit to the camp, having taken some aid for children and others and spent time with the people in the camp. There are businesses set up by inhabitants of the camp, some semblance of normality in an abnormal situation. There are schools, cafes and drop-in centres for the young. But the French authorities seem hell-bent on destroying such necessary amenities.  It is harassment of the most vulnerable people. Give these people the right to settle in UK.

attributes.action: Stop charging NHS staff for parking fees
attributes.background:
Payments are now been increased yearly.  Not adequate parking spaces hence time wasted in mornings looking for spaces.

Other businesses have free parking facilities.

Nursing should not pay to park when saving lives.

attributes.action: Qualify MA (LPC with Business) for Postgraduate Student Finance funding.
attributes.background: Student Finance has recently announced that from 1 August 2016 it will be possible to apply for up to £10,000 funding to pay for the course and the living expenses.  Currently this does not include the Legal Practice Course with integrated  Masters.
attributes.additional_details: Students who cannot afford to pay for the course themselves do have the opportunity to complete their Legal Practice course. If Student Finance is available for Masters, then it should also be available for the other postgraduate courses which include Masters qualification.

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to report on the accuracy of MPs' public statements.
attributes.background: The EU referendum highlighted the damage that can be caused by false & misleading information. We the undersigned propose that an independent panel should be established to report to the public on the validity and accuracy of MPs' public comments.
attributes.additional_details: At the heart of democracy is clear information sharing & communication. MPs should therefore be held to account for the validity of information they share. We advise that the Independent Panel will assess MPs' comments upon request from the public. Each comment could be assessed as to whether it is factually correct/incorrect, verifiable/unverifiable, or misleadingly presented. There could be sanctions for repeat offenders of misleading information & an 'honesty' league table of MPs.
